TITLE: 3 investing tips as the federal debt ceiling 'X-date' approaches
SUMMARY: Many investors are bracing for economic fallout as the federal debt ceiling "X-date" deadline approaches. Here's how to invest, according to advisors.

TITLE: Are lower-income Americans paying for wealthy consumers' credit card rewards? Some economists say they are
SUMMARY: Who pays for your credit card rewards? Some economists say there's an annual redistribution of more than $15 billion from lower-income to wealthier Americans.

TITLE: How the student loan payment pause has made it easier for public servants to get forgiveness
SUMMARY: Student borrowers pursuing public service loan forgiveness haven't had to make a payment on their debt in years. Still, they've moved closer to getting relief.

TITLE: Many companies are adding, expanding tuition assistance so workers can go back to college
SUMMARY: In the last few years, more companies have expanded their benefit offerings with free college programs to attract and retain workers.

TITLE: Thanks to vesting schedules, it can take up to 6 years for workers to own their 401(k) match
SUMMARY: Vesting rules set by an employer dictate how soon a worker can leave a company and take their full match with them.

TITLE: Here's the 'most likely scenario' for when student loan payments could restart — and how to prepare
SUMMARY: Borrowers may be down to their last few months without a student loan payment. Here's how to prepare for bills to resume.

TITLE: Here are ways retirees can protect nest eggs during a stock market rout
SUMMARY: The market may contract along with the economy in a possible recession, but there are ways retirees can protect the nest egg they're living off of, expert says.

TITLE: When couples say they broke up over money, it's not the real reason, therapist says. Here's what is
SUMMARY: Psychoanalyst Orna Guralnik said money is one of the biggest stressors on relationships. But she sees a way forward for couples fighting about their finances.

TITLE: Social Security benefits for oldest and poorest could be first at risk in debt default, expert says
SUMMARY: As the debt ceiling deadline approaches, a default may interfere with Social Security checks for some of the most vulnerable beneficiaries, one expert warns.

TITLE: Young adults are taking longer to reach 'key life milestones' impacting finances later, analysis shows
SUMMARY: In terms of finances, young adults are taking longer to reach "key life milestones," compared to four decades ago, according to a Pew Research Center analysis.

TITLE: College enrollment continues to slide as more students question the value of a four-year degree
SUMMARY: Increasingly, high school students are rethinking the value of a four-year college.

TITLE: Here's why TSA PreCheck makes sense during a busy travel season — if you can get it in time
SUMMARY: Federal programs like TSA PreCheck and Global Entry, which typically cut down wait times at the airport, have gotten a record number of applications.

TITLE: Share of six-figure earners living paycheck to paycheck jumps, report finds. Advisor offers ways to break the cycle
SUMMARY: Aside from income, where you live is the most important factor in determining whether you will live paycheck to paycheck.

TITLE: House Democrats, looking to renew plan to expand Social Security, say debt ceiling fight 'hurts seniors the most'
SUMMARY: As the clock ticks to resolve the debt ceiling ahead of a June 1 deadline, congressional Democrats on Tuesday moved to renew a Social Security reform proposal.

TITLE: More taxpayers will receive tax forms from apps such as Venmo, PayPal for 2023. Here's how to avoid tax issues
SUMMARY: More taxpayers will receive Form 1099-K from apps such as Venmo and PayPal for 2023. Here's how to prepare for next year's taxes.

TITLE: Guaranteed lifetime income gains appeal amid worries a recession is coming
SUMMARY: More retirement savers are considering some type of guaranteed lifetime income amid concerns about the economy and the possibility of a recession.

TITLE: What parents need to know about P2P payment apps as Venmo adds teen account
SUMMARY: Here's how parents can protect teens from common peer-to-peer payment issues, according to a consumer watchdog.

TITLE: Women need financial freedom to 'live on their terms,' advisor says. These 3 strategies can help
SUMMARY: When it comes to money, women face unique challenges in building wealth. Here's what one advisor says they can do to feel more empowered.

TITLE: How to capture higher savings yields with a CD ladder
SUMMARY: Here's how a CD ladder can capture higher savings yields amid interest rate uncertainty, financial experts say.

TITLE: Op-ed: Why cash is king for emergency funds and queen for short-term savings
SUMMARY: With interest rates soaring, it's the perfect time for building an emergency fund, which is essential in high- and low-interest rate environments.

TITLE: Here's how much wedding guests are spending as inflation, interest rates are 'taking a toll,' expert says
SUMMARY: Wedding guests are now spending more than $600, on average, on travel and accommodations, gifts and special-occasion attire and preparation, a new report finds.

TITLE: As investors worry about a recession, take 3 steps to boost your financial security, advisor says
SUMMARY: Negative headlines have some Americans fearing the worst for the economy, but there are still ways to improve your financial outlook now, one advisor says.

TITLE: IRS reveals 2024 health savings account limits. What to know about the 'significant increase,' says advisor
SUMMARY: The IRS is providing a sizable increase for the 2024 health savings account contribution limits. Here's what taxpayers need to know.

TITLE: Should college graduates be financially independent? Parents and young adults disagree
SUMMARY: College graduates may be heading out into the world, but it could be years before they are able to pay their own way.

TITLE: Op-ed: Your child got accepted to college — now protect their 529 plan savings
SUMMARY: Barry Glassman, a certified financial planner and CNBC FA Council member, shares his experience with 529 college savings plans as a financial advisor and a dad.

TITLE: As Democrats update their plan for national paid family and medical leave, here's what it could mean for workers
SUMMARY: The U.S. is the "only industrialized nation" without a national paid family and medical leave plan, one lawmaker says. An updated proposal aims to change that.

TITLE: The free online tax-filing system IRS is testing doesn't include automated returns — but pre-populated ones may be possible, research shows
SUMMARY: The IRS is testing free direct filing for some taxpayers in 2024. Research shows that pre-populated tax returns may be possible for some filers.

TITLE: Young investors are selling stocks and using retirement savings for emergencies
SUMMARY: Younger investors tell pollsters they plan to invest more, but research shows they're actually tapping investments and savings to pay for everyday expenses.

TITLE: Sen. Bernie Sanders renews push for Medicare for All to end 'totally broken' health-care system
SUMMARY: Health-care costs can lead to financial strain for many individuals and families. Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., is pushing to change that with Medicare for All.

TITLE: Americans think gold beats stocks as a long-term investment. Advisors disagree: 'It's more like a speculation'
SUMMARY: A Gallup poll found Americans are bullish on gold, which tends to rise in popularity as an investment during periods of fear and economic malaise.
